metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8631 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple memory leaks in kadmin/server/server_stubs.c in kadmind in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.13.4 and 1.14.x before 1.14.1 allow remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a request specifying a NULL principal name. It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled principal names. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8631` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-gss-samples - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-k5tls - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-kdc - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-locales - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-multidev - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-otp - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-pkinit - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-user - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libgssrpc4 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libk5crypto3 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkadm5clnt-mit9 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkadm5srv-mit9 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkdb5-8 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkrad0 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkrb5-3 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkrb5support0 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
No subscription required

notes.Note: ratliff> use of kadmind in core and touch is not supported

criterions.comment: krb5 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.13.2+dfsg-5').
